origin:
The U.S. will pay for climate change whether or not the Green New Deal is in place.

The question is: Will we invest in a bold plan to boost the economy or will we pay for the damage from intense hurricanes, floods, droughts, wildfires, sea level rise & ecological devastation.
replies: Nobody is debating that, don't be obtuse. Climate Change just works better than "Irreversible Man-Made Climate Change"

It‚Äôs not irreversible, one big volcanic eruption could easily put us in an ice age. Just ask the dinosaurs. Climate changes, poles reverse and life goes on. Cycles have been here since the dawn of time and will be here after we are gone.

Science denial is not an argument.

Volcanos:   https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/earthtalks-volcanoes-or-humans/¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/1j04dTTdGy

Your question poses a false alternative. The plan will not boost the economy. It will stunt growth for all except the chosen green cronies. Leaving people free to use technology to improve our lives, in the face of all challenges, is the only moral and practical solution.

The Green New Deal, like the original New Deal, is government authoritarianism wrapped up in an emergency‚Äôs clothing. While I believe climate change is real, it cannot be fixed by government. Sacrificing rights and people is not moral. The ends do not justify the means.
Uh, who exactly is going to be sacrificed and have their rights taken away?
Anyone who owns a house with oil heat, a car that runs on gas or who eats beef for starters.
Jonpatriot omlissbliss TylerRevolution AmyPeikoff RoKhanna AOC
Nothing within the green new deal says that these things are outright banned.
jdevine889 omlissbliss TylerRevolution AmyPeikoff RoKhanna AOC
Then how do you get to net zero emissions? It states every building needs to be retrofitted, all cars to be electric and the elimination of cow farts.
Jonpatriot omlissbliss TylerRevolution AmyPeikoff RoKhanna AOC

I wil happily admit that the GND is at many points naive. However, I don‚Äôt necessarily think that this is a bad thing. If positive nativity causes some reasonable action to take place then I will be happy. The World is changing because of us and we need to change to adapt.
jdevine889 omlissbliss TylerRevolution AmyPeikoff RoKhanna AOC

Then they should be honest. In reality the GND looks like a power grab designed to control every aspect of our lives. If we want to deploy technology then the place to start is carbon capture, water desalination and of course conservation.

Those costs are pale in comparison to the cost of walking across the country for meetings when air travel is outlawed.  Or having to import all our beef because farmers cannot afford the flatulence tax.

You seem to have missed some details.

GND will not ‚Äòoutlaw‚Äô air travel, simply try to reduce dependancy on it by expanding alternatives.

(Also, we‚Äôre both using an instantaneous form of long distance communication that renders cross country travel for meetings needless).
Further, cows primarily release methane through burps, and the amount can be vastly reduced by changing their diet.

And how big is your cattle operation that your expertise comes from? Do you even live in the country or another city raised self - proclaimed expert on agriculture? Come out to the Midwest and meet with real cattle farmers.

Ah yes, the old ‚Äòyou‚Äôre not from the country so you have no idea, city slicker‚Äô argument. Well played.

Can you dispute that the majority of methane produced by cows comes from burps? Nows your time to show up a dumb city hippy, c‚Äômon now!
If you have no ecosystem because of pollution, you have no world. Economics will have to deal with changes to green solutions. A clean environment is not a choice, it's a matter of life.
Rev Dr Kathleen Raphael DD LPN
